p: The list of VEEV strains classified under the epizootic varieties (associated with equine-amplified epidemics) and enzootic varieties (maintained in rodent-mosquito cycles and generally not equine amplification-competent) of VEEV subtype I (VEEV IAB, IC, ID, and IE) was comprised after consultation with multiple institutes with known VEEV repositories, and did not include former VEE complex subtypes IIâ€“VI and VEEV IF due to their reclassification as distinct species that are now referred to by their prototype strain [ 8]. Relevant data for each strain included the source of the isolate, passage history, and country/year of initial isolation.
